intro: Leucas pachmarhiensis, commonly known as the Pachmarhi leucas, is a flowering plant native to the central Indian region, particularly the Pachmarhi area in Madhya Pradesh. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
